column4: folks! i had xchat gnome installed previously. it didnt leave a colorful icon like the regulat xchat did
i just uninstalled the gnome version and installed the regualr xchat, but my gnove version is still listed in the internet catagor
how do i remove it completly
deathstar, thats for me?
Try right clicking on the menu bars, and then click edit menus
removing it completely? You could go into the Synaptic Package Manager and mark it for complete removal..
System -> Administration -> Synaptic Package Manager; and, if you're addressing someone, please put their name in your response/question
Glad I can be of help
You should be able to find xchat-gnome in the repos.. Just click in the window where all the packages are, and type xchat, for example to search for it.
You're welcome
You've lost me there. :P I'm rather new to Ubuntu as well, and I don't know that.
I chose Ubuntu as it is one of the more popular distrobutions, as well as it's user-friendliness
You can set the root password.. I don't remember exactly how, you could do a quick google search and find it easily
I haven't tried any other distro as of yet
it's better than being insecure
I've read up on them before I chose one. I was tired of Windows and decided to put in a dual boot.
pretty much :P
Cyphase was referring to Windows 2.0... (i.e. the basic text prompt, no mouse support..)
That's part of the user-friendliness I was talking about :P
There WAS something before 3.1...
Windows had a 1.0 too.. you expect them to start at 3.1 for just some random reason? lol
